response.answer_text: What tense is preterite? It is what we call the “simple past” in English: I came, I went, I bought a book, etc. The preterite case is called different things in different languages - in French, for example, it’s called the “historic past” - le passé historique; in Italian, it's called passato remoto -The “remote past”. As far as I have been able to ascertain, the term “preterite” is only used when talking about its equivalent tense in Spanish, (pretérito). Portuguese (pretérito perfeito) and Catalan (preterit).
